main event: Multiple unidentified flying object sightings were reported in Mississippi and Ohio in 1954, including a cylindrical object with hemispheres, glowing orbs moving erratically at high speeds, and a bluish-white disc sighted over Cincinnati's General Electric plant.
interesting points: The sighting in Mississippi involved objects moving from 6,000 to 25,000 feet from west to east, with no sound, trail, or flashing lights, and appeared to be cylindrical with no reflections and no sound noted.

Witnesses in Ohio reported objects hovering stationary, then moving erratically at high speeds, emitting bright light, and changing shape rapidly before dashing out of sight, estimated to be moving at around 1000 mph.
The report from Keesler Air Force Base in Mississippi noted that the objects' high speed and maneuverability were beyond the capabilities of any aircraft or helicopter currently in use.
A sighting in Cincinnati involved a low-flying bluish-white disc, which multiple observers were confident were flying saucers, prompting further investigation in the area.
The UFO report from Pascagoula, Mississippi, involved students as observers, adding credibility to the sightings.
sighted object: cylindrical object with hemispheres, glowing orbs, and bluish-white disc
